result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Final pre-trial on January 17, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom; re: moton by defense; ATty Short offers argument for bail modification; ADA Cogbill argues for cash bail & BMP; response by Atty Short; Ct modifies bond; Ct adjourned.
referral form to bail monitoring

AMENDED SIGNATURE BOND - REFERRAL TO BMP
- The court orders a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following her release from jail.
-  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $500 per case. If Defendant posts this bail, the Sheriff shall notify DCBM. The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant shall continue to cooperate with DCBM. [Upon a subsequent failure to comply, the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the Court. If the defendant is not in custody, a body only bench warrant will be issued.]

Defendant appeared.  Colette Catherine Sampson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 09:00 am.
